doc.repnme: Risk and private power : a role for the World Bank
doc.abstracts: Independent power projects typically are structured on a project finance basis. Guarantees to the lenders result from the project itself rather than from the project sponsors. The problem is that lenders are reluctant to participate in projects where they are exposed to government policy failure risk. The World Bank could play an important role in promoting private investment in power by helping to overcome this risk problem. The author suggests how.
